website_summaries.verdict: Packs three control devices into one remote unit, with the so-so performance that can result from such a configuration.
pros: Able to navigate and scroll through Windows 8 tiles and Media Center
Owners are generally happy with warranty service
cons: Programming can be difficult, and remote-to-remote pairing is a bit glitchy
When air mouse is turned on, several keypad functions are disabled
Some have trouble getting volume buttons to sync with devices
Keypad is hard to see and isn’t backlit

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 30 days, SELLER WON'T LEAVE ME ALONE
customer_reviews.text: EDIT, 3/29/16: Dear AERB: Begging me incessantly to change my review is in incredibly poor taste. I can't give you any less than a one-star review, so I will also leave a comment in your seller rating. You cannot buy away the fact that you sold me a shi**y product that does not deserve to be on the market. --- Absolute garbage. Not only was it unable to learn the IR codes from my Onkyo home theater receiver, but after a month the USB dongle is no longer recognized by any of my PCs. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Scaz

customer_reviews.title: SO-SO
customer_reviews.text: WORKS SO-SO: Keyboard layout not full, cannot enter a lot of special characters. Gyroscopic mouse works so-so, requires A LOT of "resetting" by flinging your arm up/down to reset cursor position. Mouse turns off after 10-20 seconds of inactivity, have to re-activate by pressing button with red arrow. Distance is horrible. Poor reception 9 feet away. Will not work at 12 feet or farther. Will not work across the room. Most wireless products work at 12 feet. BARELY ABLE TO ACCOMPLISH ITS TASK. SIGNIFICANT PAIN IN THE ASS AS IT IS STRUGGLING TO ACCOMPLISH ITS TASKS.
customer_reviews.author: MKRD.info

customer_reviews.title: Screwy keyboard...sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly sure why but every now and then when using the keyboard with the mouse turned off, the letters become screwy and have to resort to the on screen keyboard. While this isn't a huge problem because the majority of the time it works, it can be a bit annoying when it happens. --------------UPDATE 08/11/16----------------- Aerb Inc was kind enough to attempt to resolve my problem without being prompted. They contacted me with a couple possible fixes including putting in new batteries and reinserting the dongle. Unfortunately these didn't work, but I applaud their customer service and I'm sure the higher rated reviews of this product are well deserved.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!!! Blinky remote
customer_reviews.text: Absoulely terrible!!! Blinks constantly when the device the usb is in is turned off. Ordered one and got a replacement and it did the same thing. Now i cant return this one because it says a return of $ 0.00 since it was a replacement. Went back to the original one and cant return for refund because it says it's already gotten a replacement on file. I have a useless remote now that has to have batteries out when im done with it so it dont stay blinking and kill the batteries. Beware
customer_reviews.author: Shaun T.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for months now before posting a review. My conclusion is that this thing is cheap trash. The keyboard works when it feels like working. The IR on it is weak at best and usually takes 2 or 3 presses to register. All of this WITH fresh batteries. It is made out of thin plastic, not sturdy at all. Last night was the final straw. After frustratingly trying to type my password to access my network share while the keyboard just does whatever it wants (spamming characters, missing characters, no characters), I put it where it belongs...in the garbage bin. Avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with a micro PC in the living room for playing movies. It works very well, easy to use, though I had to go to the website to download all the drivers since the micro PC doesn't have a drive to use the included DVD. Until I was able to do this, I had to use a wired keyboard and mouse. The only problem I have with it is that it can be a pain to right click properly, as the slightest movement activates the cursor movement. To get around this, I just navigate to the item I want to right click, then turn off the mouse function.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: The appeal is that it works like a remote
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made cheap product. The appeal is that it works like a remote. However, it does not deliver. The numbers on one side and letters on the other makes it hard to type phrases that require numbers. So you have to keep flipping back and over. Eventually, the keys don't respond correctly. Some keys will not respond at all. Some keys punch out whatever key is on the other side of the remote. You're better off buying a mini wireless keyboard with a mini touchpad on it. Skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Plex users, listen here.
customer_reviews.text: It's OK for PLEX on Linux. I was looking for a non-infrared remote to use with my Linux Mint based Plex Home Theater player box thing HTPC. I was initially disappointed with the remote due to it's functionality with plex, and I was short of building my own remote. Once I turned off the cursor, the remote worked properly, but I must mention that the layout for plex is off-puting. The backspace is used to go back in menus, which is placed at the bottom of the remotes face. Now that I have plex set to auto run, the remote is great...but the learning curve was regrettably bad.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kodi
customer_reviews.text: I use this primary for a Raspberry Pi and Kodi setup that I have in my car. I really wanted a remote that didnt need line of sight(IR) to work. And thus far its been great and works really well with Kodi without customization. Its also nice if you need a quick mouse/keyboard for a home theater PC that doesnt have a dedicated Mouse/Keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied none the less
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough instead of using a mouse or the small, yet still cumbersome, logitech HTPC keyboard I've been using on my HTPC. I can now put away that mouse, keyboard, TV remote, and Stereo remote and just have this on the coffee table instead. Its serves it's purpose well. Set up took a second to figure out, but is simple once you do. Only wish for more programmable buttons. Very satisfied none the less.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Farley

customer_reviews.title: As an Air Mouse it Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with my Matricom G-Box Q2 Android TV. Three words "Plug And Play", "Really works Great", "Worth The Price". I have been using it for about a week now and it works great. My Matricom G-Box Q2 Android TV is about 15 feet away and it works flawlessly. Need my reading glasses for the Keyboard Function keys. There was a poor coloring choice for the symbols on the buttons above the navigation pad but other than that every thing works great.
customer_reviews.author: M. P. Mac Runnel

customer_reviews.title: it's much easier to setup - Keyboard works well - Mouse it much better than I
customer_reviews.text: Cons - when reversed, keys at the bottom are not actually disabled, they are bound to other keys on the front. this causes miss clicks or if you hold it sideways can do unexpected things. - never got reprogramming feature work. IR features simply does not work - It's says it's compatible with KODI systems but even for the very basic things you have to use keymapper application to get it working. - Sometimes key presses will not register Pros - It's wifi, so you don't need to point it directly to your device. it's much easier to setup - Keyboard works well - Mouse it much better than I expected
customer_reviews.author: Serkan Y.

customer_reviews.title: fair build quality, but has flaws
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! if you assign an IR button to the power button, you CANNOT change it back to default (power command via usb USB dongle) if you like to be able to power on your media device without having to point the IR at it, then never use the power button for IR learning. here is the email response I got from customer service: Dear friend, Thanks so much for contacting us. As for this issue, you can just not remove it. You can just exchange it with our function settings. So sorry for that. rough English, I assume "function settings" means "learn/reassign a new IR"
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kodi remote
customer_reviews.text: Love this remote. I have the Rii 8, but this is better! The air mouse feature is million times better than a mouse track pad. I like that it takes standard batteries, ensuring long term use and replaceable batteries. The only request is that they make one with a backlit keyboard. Then it would be the only remote I would ever recomend. It allows all the controls of a stock kodi remote and then some. Other remotes are missing the power button and other buttons do not do the functions that are labeled as they are really made for computer navigation. But his remote can replace your kodi remote no question.
customer_reviews.author: Bfree

customer_reviews.title: Based on the reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to get some horribly low quality, borderline useless remote control, but that's not at all the case here. Not only is the quality decent, but the functionality is great, the layout is very intuitive, the IR functionality works perfectly, and the air mouse works (surprisingly) very well. Some people have said that the layout is weird, but I just gave the buttons a quick look, played with the remote for a few minutes, and it felt like I'd been using this remote for years. I'm a little bummed that I didn't get a printed manual with mine, but the remote is easy enough to figure out with just the information graphic here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ian B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Media Center Device with excellent customer service!!...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for me on a Raspberry Pi3, OpenElec V:8.0.4 device. Update, 1/23/18: Also works great on Android TV boxes(S905, S905X, etc) running LibreElec and OpenElec. Also, I had one that I purchased in 6/2017 fail recently and after trying a few tips sent by the Seller(Dinosonics) in an attempt to fix the issue, they graciously offered to replace it free of charge when those tips didn't work. The replacement came quickly and worked perfectly, hopefully for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: ghudson58

customer_reviews.title: New versions do not work!
customer_reviews.text: Junk now. Something changed with these remotes lately. We had two of them that we bought from this exact link a couple years ago, aside from some slightly shoddy assembly worked otherwise fine. Now that they're worn out, I've tried two of these. Returned the first, wife decided to just live with the second one. The remote outright stops responding overnight. Works fine until it's idle for a while, then no matter what you do it just blinks like there's no dongle, regardless of whether the computer is sleeping or not. Something in the receiver is broken now. Both that we got recently do this. Try another brand, they're mostly the same configuration wise.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Good Remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote is very nice, but has a couple major flaws. The mouse function is very hard to control. When trying to tilt and point the remote to control the cursor on screen, it just drifts around to anywhere it wants. It is tricky to click on something, and can take several minutes. Also, when using the remote it often doubles or triples your button presses. So when you push up, it may go up 2 or 3 times. **UPDATE** After receiving a replacement, the remote works very well. It seems the first one had a mechanical defect.The replacement works perfectly, and customer service was extremely helpful throughout this process.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This remote works great with Amazon Fire TV! (but not Amazon Fire Stick.)
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure it would and thought others might appreciate the review. I was able to program the 4 buttons on the bottom to turn my TV on and off (red) change the input (green) and turn the volume up and down (yellow and blue). It's a great cheap alternative to more expensive universal remotes and is convenient compared to having two remotes to keep track of. Also, the keyboard on the back is nice when inputting text for searches. Be careful if you intitate the remote mouse option without realizing it. It will make the other functions stop working until it is turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie J. Thoreson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with Android TV.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if my unit was defective or what, but it simply didn't work for my needs. I have an all new entertainment center including an Nvidia Shield Android TV set top box and wanted a more efficient means of navigating and entering text. Half of the buttons simply didn't do anything. For example, the directional buttons worked, but the OK button didn't. Useless. Returned. I got the Inteset remote. WORKS GREAT and easily programmable!
customer_reviews.author: swinefuzz

customer_reviews.title: Update: Not so great remote mouse. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: This remote works great and has a good range. Sometime it needs to be resynced to stop the mouse pointer drifting. Update Apr 4 2018. It's now impossible to get the mouse pointer to stop drifting with no motion on my part. the pointer drifts to the left of the screen and it's impossible to select anything because the pointer is constantly moving. Skip this product it's not worth the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: This is brilliant for a media server.
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with an old wireless keyboard with a ball mouse for years. This thing is brilliant. The remote control unit it's self is a mouse. Just plug it into the pc (windows 10) and it just works. Hold the unit and the cursor on the screen moves with it. You can mouse click dbl click and right click. You can run a whole pc based media server from this one cheap device. The volume works as well. Also I will be testing it on a pi zero with Xbmc soon. If you need a keyboard mouse remote combo just buy it you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works really well on my Mac!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this at first, but it turned out to be an really smart buy! I have my desktop connected to my computer and with this I can turn my TV off and on and change inputs AND use it as a mouse and keyboard! The keyboard is pretty decent and while I can't type on it as fast as I can type on a full keyboard or smartphone, it's so light and small and convenient! The mouse feature is way better than I ever expected it to be, you can click the mouse off/on with one button and there are separate buttons for left click and right click.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip J. Fry

customer_reviews.title: Great Device. Using with an MXQ Pro box and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Device. Using with an MXQ Pro box and it has made a world of difference. The 4 programmable buttons on the bottom really finish this thing off as a complete remote for everything I use. This works great in an Andriod environment as well as with Kodi. Mouse is responsive and keyboard is great. I was using a wireless keyboard with a tracpad, won't ever use that again for a media box if I don't have to. Range is excellent and remote does not need to be directly pointed at the dongle to register button clicks. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: E Bega

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a week so far. It is working well. Prefer it to the Rii remote which whose air mouse wasn't as accurate. The air mouse on this one is much eaiser to use. I like the IR learning functions. With it, I can control the volume and on/off button on my TV set. Flipping it around shuts off the mouse and lets me type. Very nice. Would be better if it had function keys though. Overall I really like the remote so far.
customer_reviews.author: rudeboyrg

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Flaws
customer_reviews.text: Too many of the buttons don't work as intended. The "back" and "list" buttons did nothing on two different android tv devices (Fire TV, and NVidia Shield). I am sure there is a device somewhere that responds to all of these buttons properly, but I don't know what that device is. IR Learning works as described, but the placement of these buttons makes it awkward to push them frequently. Some of the icons on the buttons are printed in dark blue on a black background, why? That is so difficult to see.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebull32

customer_reviews.title: This remote feels solid and buttons feel great but cant compete with my old remote because I ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes when I bought this remote. My current one is starting to fall a part ( Feilan PC-TV remote also purchased from amazon ). This remote feels solid and buttons feel great but cant compete with my old remote because I cant program my TV buttons. I need a remote that can replace TV, Cable and PC (Kodi) and for that it needs to be IR IF all buttons programmable. This would be ultimate remote if only had Feilan's remote all buttons programing capability.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Best, mini wireless keyboard/mouse ever!
customer_reviews.text: Works with Kodi on both Mac OS 10.10 and Raspberry Pi. Easy to set up, just plug in the USB receiver and it works without any software to install. The mouse is surprisingly accurate and intuitive, a lot like a Wii remote. There is a button to turn the mouse on and off so that it can be used as a keyboard without the motion sensor moving the mouse all over the screen. The remote does not have a place to store the USB receiver within itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amos Hairston

customer_reviews.title: Fun great remote
customer_reviews.text: This is the size of a regular remote control. It's so much fun to use the pointer... It's like playing with the Wii remote. The functions are great the keypad is amazing. All I did was plug and play. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: i use one for my computer and another for my fire tv (I hate the factory remote because it's hard to type)
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Aerb 2.4G Mini Wireless Keyboard that i buy. i use one for my computer and another for my fire tv (I hate the factory remote because it's hard to type) , I tried others that looked exactly the same from other companies that were a few dollar cheaper but don't waste your time or money, those did not work, I ended up returning them and thankfully i got the money back. the brand "Aerb" you can trust. this mini keyboard works every time, it's easy to set up and they ship it quickly, i got it within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Angel O.

customer_reviews.title: Great, it works as it's supposed to and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great, it works as it's supposed to and it enables me to access web content on a PC directly connected to my television via an HDMI cable. If you're looking for a way to access web content on a television without having to use a keyboard and mouse, this works great. It works just by pointing at the screen and the mouse moves around accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Frog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect "mouse from the couch" solution with "lite keyboard needs" for anyone with a Media Center PC!
customer_reviews.text: I use a "Media Center PC" in my family room (Windows 8.1 with Media Center) for all TV viewing, Gaming (via Steam), etc. But I needed a good "mouse from the couch" option that was not a touchpad. This device has a small keyboard for occasional data entry (i.e. tv show search) and an "air mouse" (think like using a Wii remote) for clicking. Windows 8.1 gets flack for the metro/modern UI tile thing, but it is a GREAT interface for a Media Center PC as the tiles are ONE CLICK while a "desktop shortcut" is two which is marginally harder to do with an airmouse. Size is perfect too for use in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: OldeCr0m

customer_reviews.title: Great remote for a HTPC device
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to control a Gbox Q device. This remote is more convenient than the original provided. I love the keyboard in the back, that saves so much time when searching for movies or browsing the web. I love the fact that the pointer can be used as a mouse or disabled to be used like the original remote. I love it and I do not regret getting it. Edit: I bought a second one for my other Matricom box. I wished the clicks weren't so loud but still a great remote for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Yannick Evenas

customer_reviews.title: Learning functions will not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit back in January to control a new streaming box I purchased. It works well for that purpose, but it wasn't until over a month later that I tried to program a learning function to control my television that I discovered that function did not work. I have purchased at least 5 of these units in the past and they all worked perfectly. This is the only time I have had this problem. I would have liked to contact the seller, but I don't see any way to do that directly.
customer_reviews.author: lrob

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, needs better QA or internal design
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this remote at first. I purchased it for my Kodi on Raspberry Pi 3, running OpenELEC. It was as simple as plug-and-play. However, about a week of using it is all I got before it acted up. when typing, if I press the 'O' button, the remote would send the corresponding button on the other side. That means no more typing. Anything with U, J, M, I, K, L or special characters such as ,.<> and backspace would mess up what I was typing.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Gets Daily Use
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a Linux (Mint 17) based media PC with Kodi as the front-end. Out of the box, the remote worked fine. I have no issues with the air mouse feature, it turns on and off at a button press and stays in that state until switched. The keyboard on back is nice, so much better than clicking around the on-screen keyboard. The remote is comfy and has most of the buttons you need. It would have been 5 stars, but the button layout is just a bit odd. It is also a remote designed for Windows...Linux users are used to that, but it is a little annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Slick little device
customer_reviews.text: Bought to control HTPC in childs room, seems to fit the application perfectly & is a clever design as well. Pros: Compact smooth cursor movement querty keyboard Cons: Doesn't seem to have Left/right Mouse buttons mapped (OK appears to function as Right click) In general this seems to get the basics of controlling a HTPC running Win7 done pretty well. Wouldn't recommend typing your thesis on the keyboard, but it \'s good enough for the occasional password or URL. Can't say anything about it's long term reliability since I just got it, but I'll update this if it doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.author: RO

customer_reviews.title: Ken Ober Would Approve
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up and works great with my Android box. Line of sight not necessary and can use it as a mouse for touchscreen-like control of apps. Definitely beats the stock remote that came with the box. Would definitely purchase again. Cons: - Alpha keys are a bit small for my hands but that is to be expected for something like this. I'm sure there's a joke in there about having big hands... - Every now and then, the back button gets "stuck" and presses over and over. Not sure if that is the remote or the software running on the box just yet. Will update if I figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Tripp

customer_reviews.title: It works, but...
customer_reviews.text: It works, but is lacking some functionality. I bought this product to control a Cenovo computer. It connects very well; and it has good sensitivity. One major issue that I have with this product is that it cannot be used in low lighting. The ALT key and ALT functions in the keyboard are in blue color set on the black rubber buttons. Therefore, in low light, there is now way to see and use the ALT function. It would have been best is the ALT key and ALT functions on the other keys were set in a fluorescent material.
customer_reviews.author: spedrini

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a multi-function remote/mouse!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great remote! I use Kodi media center and at first, was not used to this remote. It does not have a 'stop' button for media. But, I have been able to figure out how to use it with Kodi. Plus, it has 4 programmable keys, which I use for media box and TV power, as well as volume. I love it, as I don't have to use 3 remotes to power my media anymore! My only cons about this device is the letters/numbers on the keyboard are very hard to see. Backlighting of the keys would be a big help! And, more programmable keys! Great product otherwise! I have already ordered 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: Dana B

customer_reviews.title: Best remote you can get for under $100
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so we can all agree when you hear the brand name Aerb, you're like, ummm, who? But this remote WAY exceeded expectations. I expected maybe the directional buttons and maybe the okay buttons to work out of the box, but it is as plug-and-play as you can get. The keyboard on the back works right away, the play/pause buttons works right away, the mouse mode works right away! This remote is perfect and possibly the foundation for Aerb. Would definitely recommend. Works perfectly on Windows 10 and Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Who needs the manual? Threw some batteries in it ...
customer_reviews.text: Who needs the manual? Threw some batteries in it, plugged the dongle in and had a cursor on my screen within a minute. Giving 4 starts because I cannot confirm all of the cons of others (or my full use case) Worked a treat with Jriver and other applications that I wanted it for. Items I didnt test 1) The button to disable the gyro -- I didn't need it as soon as I flipped it over, the cursor went away, as expected 2) I was close to my PC, so didnt' strain the IR - Yet to test beyond 5 feet 3) Programmable 4 buttons at the bottom
customer_reviews.author: dual-ccie

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had the Microphone
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5 star but mine didn't come with a microphone, I use Voice control for home automation, and I was hoping to use this with all of my Kodi setups, but due to no microphone I now use with my portable media center that I run on a Raspberry pi B+, only took a little bit of configuration, and it was ready to go
customer_reviews.author: peglegtv

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn my unit on or off.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works on this except the on and off switch. I wrote customer service and they said that they didn't have the technology to do that yet. They offered me a partial refund. Don't recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: I Still Read Books

customer_reviews.title: Getting it to move the cursor around the screen is easy enough. Getting it to do anything useful has ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm at a loss as to how to rate this product. Getting it to move the cursor around the screen is easy enough. Getting it to do anything useful has completely eluded me. Also note that it's keyboard lacks the booster keys necessary to use the standard Windows keyboard shortcuts.
customer_reviews.author: Hoken

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: The IR blaster is placed right at the end of the device so when trying to type you cover up the sensor. Hardly any of the buttons recognize on the Xbox one x. The keyboards lags bad on kodi. It just a poorly designed cheap remote. I definitely want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Sue.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It feels like you are holding a much more advanced Nintendo Wii remote that is much more accurate. Makes control the computer an ease while it is connected to the projector.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: ... GBox Q from Matricom which comes with a totally useless Remote Control
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a GBox Q from Matricom which comes with a totally useless Remote Control. This Remote works perfectly with the GBox Q. The learning feature allowed me to program the control to turn on the GBox Q the TV and to switch the TV to the proper HDMI port. The mouse is another nice feature. It's a little bit difficult to maintain the mouse prompt in position while hitting the Ok Button but after a while you get use and it becomes easy task. The keyboard works as expected and the range is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Garcia

customer_reviews.title: This is a very cool device. I have an HTPC in a closet ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool device. I have an HTPC in a closet upstairs and this connects without issue. SOO much easier than using the arrow buttons on a remote control. A bit of a learning curve, and the non-standard key layout is hard to see in dim lighting. The unit turns off after 5 seconds of inactivity, the first key press wakes it up and the 2nd press registers so you need watch the screen all the time. The wireless dongle might be dogging my wi-fi a bit, but can't confirm it's this. A good purchase, will buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Chas1560

customer_reviews.title: pretty great for htpc/kodi/plex
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It is not a full size keyboard replacement (no cmd/control/alt keys, no tab key, tiny) but it will work if you need to search YouTube or enter a url. The "air mouse" is just ok. But - if you are using kodi/xmbc or plex, it can take over from your keyboard, you can use the air mouse to get to the application. The fact that it learns from your remote is awesome - no more codes, just point tv remote and push the button.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdkraft

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with HTPC and Kodi
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my HTPC and Kodi. The home button doesn't seem to work but everything else is great. It was easy to program the programmable buttons and using it to control the sound bar. The air mouse works. It would be useful in a pinch but it's mostly kept off. Having the keyboard in the back feels a little strange and the remote feels a little cheap. Would recommend to anyone with a HTPC and Kodi installed.
customer_reviews.author: Chanh55

customer_reviews.title: Nice Remote for G-Box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a Matricom GBox. It works fairly well. For it to be the perfect remote, it would need to operate both the TV and the Gbox. I wish it had universal remote capabilities built into it. This way it could control both the TV and the Gbox. It does come with 4 programmable buttons that learn from your original remote, so at least you can program one button to turn on and off the TV, however there is no volume control for the tv. All in all, a good choice still
customer_reviews.author: UnitMaster

customer_reviews.title: All around good remote
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice air mouse. Responsive and accurate my tv is about 15 feet from couch and this has no problems with connection. Have not had any missed keystrokes. I cannot comment on the battery life as i have only been using for 4 days. Directions are clear and easy to follow. Programmable ir bottons work great i can power on tv and android box with 1 remote. Only CON: i wish it had rechargeable battery. But i expected this when buying. Update: the rechargeable battery doesnt matter as the batteries have not dies yet 6 months later
customer_reviews.author: Dt27

customer_reviews.title: I like what I am able to do with this so ...
customer_reviews.text: I like what I am able to do with this so far. I am using it to control my desktop from a distance. Mostly to change the volume and to select different songs to play. One thing I have done make it easier is to use the accessibility program Magnify in order to read the text on the screen from across my room.
customer_reviews.author: James Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for Kodi
customer_reviews.text: The learn functions are useful, though it would be nice if the volume+/- buttons were IR capable, I had to remap those functions to the colored buttons at the bottom. Keys work great, receiver works well, keyboard is comfortable enough. I use this in conjunction with OpenELEC/Kodi and it works awesome without any remapping. The plastic construction is a bit cheap-feeling and the remote takes batteries instead of being rechargeable, which I don't care for.
customer_reviews.author: Pdimens

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised. IR Learning is horrible and useless!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with G-box Q and wonderful on Kodi. Air mouse works well. However, Im giving it 2 stars because the learning feature is horrible! After 20+ presses it might turn my tv off or on. Sometimes it will turn it on after the 1st press. Other times I can hit it 100x and it won't do anything! I used brand new batteries, I programmed it as per instructions and it accepted the signal from my original tv remote. Customer service said it's a known issue With no solution. Thanks for telling me after you got my money!
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyproduce

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not good
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before that I had ordered from somewhere else, but this one uses batteries like crazy & the calibration seems to be off on it. Also when I turn the volume up, it goes WAY up & when I turn it down, it goes all the way down. I had ordered this one as a back up because the one that I had I could tell was on its last leg, so I didn't have to use it until recently when my other one quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Boley

customer_reviews.title: I think it works better if you keep it close to the receiver just ...
customer_reviews.text: I had some difficulty pairing this at first. I think it works better if you keep it close to the receiver just to get it paired, and then it stays paired just fine. At first I had the receiver on the back of my PC, but the signal was either blocked or receiving a lot of interference, so it was jumpy. Once I moved it to the front it worked fine. When you first use it, the sensitivity will be way too high. I had to adjust it down on the remote as well as in Windows (look for Airmouse in Devices) but now it's perfect. Programming the IR buttons was very easy and it's really useful.
customer_reviews.author: B.A.

customer_reviews.title: Best BT remote/keyboard I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This remote has far exceeded my expectations so far. I've tried several so far on my HTPC setup, but none have been issue-free until now. The remote was recognized immediately, and so far I haven't needed to "teach" any buttons on it. I also might add the rear keyboard is very responsive too. All in all it's a great buy at any price.
customer_reviews.author: LenM

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best android box remote available regardless of price
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best android box remote available regardless of price, which is really good btw. I would give it a hands down 5 star rating if they developed it just a tad further and made the keyboard lit, as its nearly impossible to use in a dimly lit room, which lets face it we all try to watch tv in. The self learning command keys are an awesome feature and you can easily set this thing up to run the what tv and audio commands you need along side your android box so you can simulataneously function the event without fumbling between remotes and codes. I have 2 of these running 2 gbox q's and it doesnt get any better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave it 5 stars because even though it doesnt control the tv its still awesome, everything works (after a bit of reconfiguring)
customer_reviews.text: the hotkeys are weird, but i just used the program auto hotkey everything to hotkey the buttons to different things. If your looking for a remote that will control your tv and computer THIS IS NOT IT! the power button turns the computer off not the tv. Gave it 5 stars because even though it doesnt control the tv its still awesome, everything works (after a bit of reconfiguring) and its waaaay better than using a wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.author: j wheels

customer_reviews.title: Great for controlling DIY cable box. Used on Raspberry Pi 2 + Kodi + Windows Media Center 7 backend.
customer_reviews.text: The first one they shipped was DOA but the second one worked just fine. They shipped fast. I ran into an issue with OpenELEC on a Raspberry Pi 2 where the keyboard side was not being recognized unless I removed the battery cover. It was odd. It worked just fine on a Windows 10 machine. I reinstalled the OS on the Pi and the remote worked fine, both keyboard and remote control side. I highly recommend it for controlling Kodi. My Pi is now a cable box thanks to WMC7 backend, Kodi as a client, and this remote as the physical user interface. It is great to have a mouse and keyboard with a familiar shape and size.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: ALT key is a pain
customer_reviews.text: Works OK. However my main gripe is the 'ALT' key on the keyboard. When engaged, I can get the desired symbol letter, but upon typing the letter, the cursor immediately ends up at the start of the word i.e. they have somehow programmed the cursor to move to the start of the word/sentence when ALT is engaged. Really strange!! If anyone is Aerb is reading this review, please help!
customer_reviews.author: socoamz

customer_reviews.title: Good combo remote
customer_reviews.text: Original unit failed, but received an updated backlit remote to replace it. I do recommend the backlit one over unlit one as the keys can be hard to see. The gyro-mouse is a little weird to get used to, but overall it's nice to have it as an option and have the keyboard on the back. Using this with an Android TV box and Kodi.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B.

customer_reviews.title: Working well. Buttons are not as smooth as I expected to be.
customer_reviews.text: very Smooth moves for cursor and all buttons work properly. Great value item for the price. Buttons are harder than I expected but I don’t have to press twice or no issue of not pressed feeling. Update after 22 months of usage: It's not durable for kids abuse. :) I wish the frame structure was made with more durable plastic like Sony or Samsung remote controls. Then I would have paid more to get this quality. Its broken to pieces after 22 months.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Somehow OK
customer_reviews.text: It's OK product. Generally well made, but apparently lacks fine tuning. Particularly annoying that: 1. On the keyboard side switching between white and blue symbols by ALT key puts cursor into beginning of the string. What's up? This button is not supposed to send anything! 2. IR buttons sometimes don't work, sometimes work twice. I'm using it with Sony Bravia TV
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: I think I liked this product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard did not function well for me, which was a large part of my decision to purchase this. I did like the pointer mouse feature. I did not try to contact support regarding the keyboard issue. The remote was dropped - probably more than once - and the case no longer goes together correctly. I've discontinued use some time ago, but mostly because I am now using an apple tv. I think I liked this product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, works well with OSMC
customer_reviews.text: Amazing remote. I made a media center using my raspberry pi (osmc OS) and it works beautifully. I was able to just plug in the usb and it started working perfectly. The remote also feels great, especially when a button is pressed. Upon pressing any button an autable "click" can be heard, which is very satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice remote
customer_reviews.text: Works good from couch with computer hooked to TV. Mouse takes a little getting use to but overall works good enough. Keyboard is fine for entering URLs and searches. TV functions programmed to buttons without any trouble (power, source, volume up and down). Media keys don't work in browser but pretty sure that's normal for any remote. Happy with purchase it works better than expected and more relaxing than using wireless keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Never had any serious issues with this remote I use it for Kodi, and it works very well. When you flip it to type on the keyboard, you have to flip very carefully and almost systematically so the remote knows it has been flipped. Otherwise it doesn't register it's upside down and it'll press random keys. Fantastic option for its price!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Snyder

customer_reviews.title: A great device that gives you a full keyboard yet blends in nicely with the other remotes on your coffee table
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the Aerb air mouse from my couch to control my Linux system which is in the other room but hooked up to my TV. It works great, no special drivers needed, and having a full keyboard is very nice compared to using on-screen keyboards. Moving the mouse pointer around with the air mouse feature works well enough for light usage, but hitting a small target like the X button on a window can be kind of tough since it's hard to be super precise. Perhaps with practice I will get better.
customer_reviews.author: WTFrak

customer_reviews.title: Nice dedicated remote
customer_reviews.text: Because Apple dropped IR from its latest iMacs, as of 2014, I bought this as a dedicated remote. Yes, I could use an iPhone or iMac as a remote, but that's not always convenient and the software is (ahem) not good. This does everything I want, mainly pause and volume control for watching Netflix and YouTube. Neat design. Can't comment on the things I don't use it for, such as gaming. I'm glad products like this are out there for those of us not entirely into the AppleSphere. Oh/ the picture shown is of one device, front and back, not two devices. Which is even better.
customer_reviews.author: Just John

customer_reviews.title: These are sooo cool. I love the keyboard on the back
customer_reviews.text: These are sooo cool. I love the keyboard on the back. very nice. on the raspberry pi it will light up red on the remote when the pi is momentarily un responsive or busy. which does not allow you to keep sending commands which is a great feature so the box does not go crazy when it catches up.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Kathrein

customer_reviews.title: I found the one through the link below to be much more useful. I've used that one since 2015
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to replace several remotes with this but it wasn't able to do that since it only has 4 ir learning buttons. I found the one through the link below to be much more useful. I've used that one since 2015. I bought this around the same time and haven't used it more than a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: this is awesome. Fair warning though
customer_reviews.text: this is awesome. Fair warning though, you need to understand this is an inertial pointer instead of a button feed or screen read. that meas as you rotate and tilt you hand the mouse will move with it. technically you hand doesn't even need to be pointed at the screen for it to work. this is great for dealing with that netflix "continue watching" bulls***. I will finish a season of trailerpark boys without having to get up.
customer_reviews.author: John Crutcher

customer_reviews.title: Good but missing key features.
customer_reviews.text: Pros--setup was easy with my HTPC and the air mouse function is good. All keys work and has been good with some abuse by a 1-year old. Cons--no dedicated Stop button. No Ctrl button on keyboard, so no Ctrl+Alt+Del functionality. With my HTPC setup with NPvr, won't play by pressing the play/pause combo button. Won't program TV keys with my TV remote. Also won't sleep or shutdown HTPC with the Power button.
customer_reviews.author: brettlg

customer_reviews.title: Did not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried numerous times to get this thing up and running but to no avail. I followed the sparse instructions and I also went on You Tube. I determined that I have a defective device. It will go back tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: DeuceA

customer_reviews.title: This isn't the remote you're looking for *waives hand like Jedi*
customer_reviews.text: The remote didn't play well with my raspberry pi 2 running kodi. I imagine these might be better with a different media player setup but since kodi seems to be a common player nowadays i would expect this remote to work better with it. Also my first remote that I got would go a little haywire.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the thing I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I like to read while laying in my bed, cuddled up and comfy, and listen to music on my computer. Often times a song comes on that I want to skip or I decide the volume IS too loud after all. This involves a lot of moving of blankets and pillows, and groaning - lots of groaning. Now I can be a lazy bum and not have to get out of bed!
customer_reviews.author: Simona

customer_reviews.title: My dog, the lummox
customer_reviews.text: At first, i was a little upset with my dog for knocking my coffee cup onto our old wireless mouse. It still functioned but the buttons would stick ever after. So, i ordered this mouse and I'm so happy i did, i actually thanked my dog (who is, in reality, a very good dog, just very large and clumsy). It's so much easier to use than the old, the full QWERTY keyboard is my favorite feature.
customer_reviews.author: soryn s

customer_reviews.title: Expected a bit more
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work ok for what it is but, I can't seem to get the tv power on/off working and I can only seem to put the PC to sleep with the remote but not wake it up again. Finally the keyboard doesn't seem to work unless mouse is completely Still
customer_reviews.author: mamamia88

customer_reviews.title: Works but lack of quality makes it a no.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this remote. I bought this for my main media center (Kodi or XBMC). There are some good points to it. It is easy. Flip it over and the keyboard is there. Just plug it in and it works. The downside is that it is cheaply made. After only 1 or 2 days, the direction pad is starting to fail. For KODI, the direction pad is a critical button and this one just won't hold up to repeated presses. I'm still looking for the perfect remote.
customer_reviews.author: cErick

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for kicking back
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected...convenient for surfing the Web while I kick back in bed. I adjusted the mouse/cursor in Windows 10 for better accuracy. You don't have to but I did. Also, flip over the remote and bam! A little keyboard for your searches. 😆 update: Learning function programed to control my Vizio VSB 200 soundbar. (Remote is a VSB210) also works on VSB200. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Good but falls short of great.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a pretty good device. I would have given it a 5 star rating IF there was a way to program any of the keys on the remote to send keystrokes (like a macro). I'm not that thrilled with how the caps and function keys operate either but can live with it. Also if you're looking for good documentation then don't look here. The entire set of documentation provided is a single 5 inch by 7 inch piece of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Harbinger

customer_reviews.title: Affordable. Quality. Combined Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: A well built, affordable wireless keyboard/remote combo. Works well with Kodi on my media center PC. Range is fairly descent and you don't have to directly point the remote at the IR receiver. Its signal bounces off walls fairly well. All-in-all this is a great little remote for the price point and a good alternative to using the keyboard/mouse. The included keyboard on the backside of the remote is a nice touch to an already great remote.
customer_reviews.author: P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: It works, but there are drawbacks: 1. ...
customer_reviews.text: It works, but there are drawbacks: 1. I cannot get the on-off button to turn on or off the PC. 2. I cannot get the programmable buttons to control a Panasonic TV. 3. The alt keys are labeled dark blue, and together with the black background, makes it hard to read. Makes it difficult to type.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me with the shield
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work with my nvidia shield. Disappointed because I thought I read others used it for the shield but maybe I was wrong. So the remote is useless to me. I was so excited hoping it would work.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice

customer_reviews.title: this remote would not pair to my TX8 S912 Android TV Box or my LG Smart TV, or Windows 10 PC
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this remote would not pair to my TX8 S912 Android TV Box or my LG Smart TV, or Windows 10 PC. I followed the pairing directions exactly and had brand new batteries. I am in the process of working out a replacement remote or refund and will update this review to reflect good or bad customer service depending on how they proceed from here.
customer_reviews.author: Glen B.

customer_reviews.title: Best remote for android TV boxes!
customer_reviews.text: I have two android boxes both different brands one is the element one the other is the pig fly. I tried this remote and others that are keyboard/mouse pad types and this is the best one of those I tried! I recommend it to make navigating the screens with ease. You can turn the pointer/mouse on or off as you need it which I like.
customer_reviews.author: Alie K

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: Got this to control the TV and the Raspberry Pi. Can't use it for the TV because it requires the original remote (which was lost a long time ago). Was also hoping I could use the D-pad to control the Raspberry pi, instead I'm stuck with the annoying wii remote style control. Not very accurate. Back button doesn't work for the Pi either. Ended up using the free Kore Android app for Kodi.
customer_reviews.author: Zlothta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended, great range, function, and price. I bought a second one for another setup, and when I buy another pi for my parents in a few weeks, this remote will be bought yet again.
customer_reviews.author: zishbu

customer_reviews.title: This remote is great for my media center PC
customer_reviews.text: This remote is great for my media center PC. I was able to program couple TV inputs on the IR learning buttons as well as power on/off to my TV and power on/off to my projector. I am able to control three devices with this small remote. It is great for watching movies, browsing the web, or doing basic file copy/paste on a computer. It is using regular batteries. Unlike other remotes that use rechargeable batteries, if the batteries go bad I can replace them and still use the remote. So far I have the remote for couple weeks and everything works good.
customer_reviews.author: vyurkiv

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our android box (gbox) because the remote that came with it absolutely sucks, it didn't have play/pause buttons and no keyboard. The mini keyboard we bought it also hated because it needed a direct sight line to the box. This one is awesome and my husband loves the air mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Don't expect the colored keys to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Don't expect the colored keys to be programmed, especially if you're using this for a kodi box. Air mouse works very well.
customer_reviews.author: placide jumonville

customer_reviews.title: If you're going to buy a remote for your computer, this is the one.
customer_reviews.text: I love gadgets. Been putting off buying a remote for my htpc for a couple of years now, as my phone is a perfectly good remote right? Wrong! This device well worth the money for it's ease of use and reliability. For an htpc it means you no longer need a keyboard or mouse, just this remote. How much more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good but...
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Windows 7 MCE - you will certainly need to map some keys with autohotkey like in some of the other reviews here. I can say that having to map a "back" button seems like something you should not have to do - and anything that is an air mouse should have dedicated left and right click buttons independent of other remote functions.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Great remote for Nvidia shield
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Nvidia shield and it works great. At first I had issues and thought it was going to stink but I switched my shield USB setting to compatibility mode and everything was great. Love the keyboard on the back and the air mouse. Both are super convinient
customer_reviews.author: jeri s stambuk

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise great product that lacks any mouse scrolling option
customer_reviews.text: Another product that seems like it was just made with no thought, no beta testing, just quick and dirty out the door. What would otherwise be a great product is totally crippled for Windows 8 to Windows 10 HTPCs by its lack of mouse scrolling. I had to download some 3rd party software that mimicks the mouse scroll wheel when the page up/page down keys are pressed, but that is a little buggy so it's not a perfect fix.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some very overlooked flaws make using this remote challenging.
customer_reviews.text: Overall does what it is supposed to do, and was delivered quickly. The alt, number, and symbol keys are near impossible to read in the best of lighting. Try typing "http://" a few times and you will see my frustration. The limited ability to control other devices such as my TV make this remote far from universal. All I can do is set it to turn my tv on and off. That's it...
customer_reviews.author: Ni

customer_reviews.title: I would have been thrilled at twice the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic remote. I would have been thrilled at twice the price. Nothing about it feels cheap. I'm using it with my Nvidia Shield and everything including the keyboard works perfectly. I can control the TV in the living room from the kitchen over 40 feet away. I just jumped on Amazon to order another for the shield in the bedroom and I figure I at least owe them a review for this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Aerb 2.4G Mini Wireless Keyboard Mouse Multifunctional W Infrared Remote Learning, 3-Gyro and 3-Gsensor, Air Control for Android Smart TV Box G Box HTPC Mini PC ,PS3/4 Xbox 360
product_meta.description:
Aerb X-A8 2.4G is multi-axes handheld pointing device, working at multi-environment for computer and other smart devices. It is plug and play, simple and smooth. It is portable and tiny, and you can carry with travel, and use for work or school or home entertainment system as a remote control device. 

It works as a mouse, which converts your space movement in the air into an accurate displacement on the screen. 
It works as a keyboard, and you can use it portable to replace your usb keyboard. 
It works as a remote, which you can program and learn some important keys from your TV remote. 
It is designed with some universal function keys, which work for most TV boxes, HTPC. (it is not granted to work for all though because some systems are customized by the vendor) 

Support System:

1. Google/ Android OS 
2. Mac OS 
3. Linux OS 
4. Windows 

Package Included:
1 * X-A8 keyboard mouse remote 
1 * USB wireless receiver 
1 * User Manual 
(AAA battery required but not included) 

Attention:
As a universal controller, some function keys might not work for your system if it is customized by its manufacture.
feature_bullets: ✔ 2.4G wireless keyboard mouse w gyro sensor and IR remote learning mouse;
✔ Alternative for USB keyboard and mouse, support Android Smart TV, IPTV, networked set-top Box,Mini PC,Android TV Box, HTPC, PCTV;
✔ Plug and play, transmission distance up to 10 meters;
✔ IR learning: it learns up to 5 keys on your TV IR remote;
✔ Air remote control: very convenient to operate in horizontal and vertical mode for game and typing.
